SDALGCP: Spatially Discrete Approximation to Log-Gaussian Cox Processes

Source: R/SDALGCP-package.R
SDALGCP-package.Rd

The SDALGCP package provides tools for continuous spatial and spatio-temporal inference using spatially aggregated disease count data. It implements a computationally efficient approximation to a log-Gaussian Cox process (LGCP) model using Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood (MCML).

Details

The package includes functionality for model fitting and prediction:

  • SDALGCPMCML estimates model parameters using MCML for spatial data.

  • SDALGCPPred performs spatial prediction (discrete and continuous) from fitted models.

  • SDALGCPMCML_ST extends the MCML approach to spatio-temporal data.

  • SDALGCPPred_ST provides prediction for spatio-temporal settings.

Additional methods include summary, print, and confint for model interpretation.

References

Christensen, O. F. (2004). Monte Carlo maximum likelihood in model-based geostatistics. Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, 13(3), 702–718. doi:10.1198/106186004X2525

Johnson, O., Giorgi, E., & Diggle, P. J. (2019). A spatially discrete approximation to log-Gaussian Cox processes for modeling aggregated disease count data. Statistics in Medicine, 38(19), 3666–3681. doi:10.1002/sim.8339

Giorgi, E., & Diggle, P. J. (2017). PrevMap: an R package for prevalence mapping. Journal of Statistical Software, 78(8), 1–29. doi:10.18637/jss.v078.i08

Banerjee, S., Carlin, B. P., & Gelfand, A. E. (2014). Hierarchical Modeling and Analysis for Spatial Data. CRC Press.
